verses.text: Jehovah a refuge and defence. ¶ For the Chief Musician. of David.¶ In Jehovah do I take refuge: How say ye to my soul, Flee [a] a bird to your mountain;
[b]If the foundations be destroyed, What can the righteous do?

footnotes.b: Or, For the foundations are destroyed; What hath the righteous wrought?

verses.text:
Jehovah trieth the righteous;
    But the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

Upon the wicked he will rain snares;
    Fire and brimstone and burning wind shall be the portion of their cup.
For Jehovah is righteous; he loveth [c]righteousness: [d]The upright shall behold his face.

footnotes.d: Or, His countenance doth behold the upright
